title: Wading Bird Population in Chesapeake Bay Food Web

content.question: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples. The food web illustrates the feeding relationships between organisms in the Chesapeake Bay, a coastal estuary in the eastern United States. (a) Based on the information in the diagram, identify a primary consumer.

frqParts.text: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples. The food web illustrates the feeding relationships between organisms in the Chesapeake Bay, a coastal estuary in the eastern United States. (a) Based on the information in the diagram, identify a primary consumer.
(b) Based on the information in the diagram, identify a population of organisms that likely has the highest amount of energy available in the food web.
(c) Based on the information in the diagram, explain why a decrease in the wading bird population would likely lead to an increase in the biomass in the large fish population in the short term.
(d) Based on the information in the diagram, identify a secondary consumer that is also a specialist species.

(e) The city of Baltimore is located on the western side of the Chesapeake Bay. Coal, natural gas and nuclear energy generate most of the electricity used in Baltimore. Describe one likely environmental problem in the Chesapeake Bay that results from the generation of electricity for Baltimore.
(f) Make a claim that proposes a realistic solution to the problem you identified in (e).
(g) For the solution you proposed in part (f), describe one additional benefit that could result from the implementation of your solution.

The land use around the Chesapeake Bay is primarily agricultural, with large areas of land that were originally forested now used for the poultry industry. Many of these poultry farms are large-scale feeding operations.(h) Many poultry farms consist of very long barns built on concrete slabs, and these buildings and the associated silos, bins, and waste lagoons together cover many acres/hectares, which require the clearing of woodlands before the farms can be built. Describe one unintended consequence that the loss of woodlands can have on the Chesapeake Bay.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe characteristics of an environmental concept, process, or model represented visually.
